result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teron Arthez Bones Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Teron Arthez Bones Sr in court.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Teron Arthez Bones Sr.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Due to court calendar congestion, case is adjourned for a sentencing hearing in branch 29.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Teron Arthez Bones in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Plea Hearing. 

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Teron Arthez Bones in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Katherine Seelow for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Teron Arthez Bones in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  
Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  State is still waiting for medical records and requests another scheduling conference date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Teron Arthez Bones in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Jessica Ann Behling for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: James Hunter - MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAB Jr unless the visitation is pursuant to DMCPS discretion, or Childrens Court TPC/Dispositional Order (whichever is superseding). If DMCPS closes out their investigation and Childrens Court has no open orders, this order is to convert into a No Violent Contact Order.

Defendant Teron Arthez Bones in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/15/22 @ 1:30p
